queries.sql: SELECT * FROM `tbl_position` WHERE `posID` = '1'

INSERT INTO `tbl_c3` (`reference`, `extent`, `question`, `yesno`, `comment`, `type`, `code`, `c3tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('', '<b>1</b>', '<b>Basis of Preparation</b>', '', '', 'section8', '3.15 Ab4', '59', 'Active', '2024-04-17 15:54:51')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c3` (`reference`, `extent`, `question`, `yesno`, `comment`, `type`, `code`, `c3tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('IAS 1.16', '1.1', 'Is there an explicit and unreserved statement that these financial statements have been prepared in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards, or have the disclosures noted in point 2 below been given?', '', '', 'section8', '3.15 Ab4', '59', 'Active', '2024-04-17 15:54:51')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c3` (`reference`, `extent`, `question`, `yesno`, `comment`, `type`, `code`, `c3tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('', '<b>2</b>', '<b>True and Fair Override</b>', '', '', 'section8', '3.15 Ab4', '59', 'Active', '2024-04-17 15:54:51')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c3` (`reference`, `extent`, `question`, `yesno`, `comment`, `type`, `code`, `c3tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('IAS 1.20 (a) to (d) ', '2.1', 'When the entity departs from a requirement of an IAS / IFRS / SIC / IFRIC due to those charged with governance believing that it is necessary to show a true and fair view, have the following disclosures been made: <ol type=\"a\"> <li>that management has concluded that the financial statements present fairly the entity’s financial position, financial performance and cash flows;</li> <li>that the entity has complied with IFRS, except that it has departed from a particular requirement to achieve a fair presentation;</li> <li>the title of the IAS / IFRS / SIC / IFRIC from which the entity has departed;</li> <li>the nature of the departure, including: <ul> <li>the treatment that would have been required; </li> <li>the reason why that treatment would be misleading; </li> <li>the treatment actually adopted; and</li> <li>for each period presented, the financial effect of the departure on each item in the financial statements that would have been reported in complying with the requirement?</li> </ul> </li> </ol>', '', '', 'section8', '3.15 Ab4', '59', 'Active', '2024-04-17 15:54:51')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c3` (`reference`, `extent`, `question`, `yesno`, `comment`, `type`, `code`, `c3tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('IAS 1.21', '2.2', 'When the entity has departed from a requirement an IAS / IFRS / SIC / IFRIC in a prior period, and that departure affects the amounts recognised in the current period, have the disclosures set out in 2.1(c) and (d) above been given?', '', '', 'section8', '3.15 Ab4', '59', 'Active', '2024-04-17 15:54:51')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c3` (`reference`, `extent`, `question`, `yesno`, `comment`, `type`, `code`, `c3tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('IAS 1.23', '2.3', 'In the extremely rare circumstance where management conclude that a departure from an IAS / IFRS / SIC / IFRIC is necessary to give a true and fair view, however, the relevant regulatory framework prohibits such as departure, have the following disclosures been given: <ul> <li>The title of the IAS / IFRS / SIC / IFRIC;</li> <li>The nature of the requirement;</li> <li>The reason why management has concluded that complying with that requirement conflicts with the requirement to give a true and fair view; and </li> <li>For each period presented, the adjustments to each item in the financial statements that management has concluded necessary to achieve a fair presentation?</li> </ul>', '', '', 'section8', '3.15 Ab4', '59', 'Active', '2024-04-17 15:54:51')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c3` (`reference`, `extent`, `question`, `yesno`, `comment`, `type`, `code`, `c3tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('Best Practice', '2.4', 'Is the effect and reason for any departure from any of the following accounting concepts disclosed: <ul> <li>Going concern;</li> <li>Consistency;</li> <li>Prudence;</li> <li>Accruals; and</li> <li>Determination of aggregate amounts by separate determination of each individual asset and liability?</li> </ul>', '', '', 'section8', '3.15 Ab4', '59', 'Active', '2024-04-17 15:54:51')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c3` (`reference`, `extent`, `question`, `yesno`, `comment`, `type`, `code`, `c3tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('', '<b>3</b>', '<b>Long and Short Accounting Periods</b>', '', '', 'section8', '3.15 Ab4', '59', 'Active', '2024-04-17 15:54:51')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c3` (`reference`, `extent`, `question`, `yesno`, `comment`, `type`, `code`, `c3tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('IAS 1.36', '3.1', 'Where the financial statements are for a period other than one year (i.e. there is a long or short accounting period) are the following disclosed: <ul> <li>That fact;</li> <li>The reason for having a longer or shorter period; and</li> <li>The fact that comparative amounts presented in the financial statements (including the related notes) are not entirely comparable?</li> </ul>', '', '', 'section8', '3.15 Ab4', '59', 'Active', '2024-04-17 15:54:51')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c3` (`reference`, `extent`, `question`, `yesno`, `comment`, `type`, `code`, `c3tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('', '<b>4</b>', '<b>Going Concern</b>', '', '', 'section8', '3.15 Ab4', '59', 'Active', '2024-04-17 15:54:51')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c3` (`reference`, `extent`, `question`, `yesno`, `comment`, `type`, `code`, `c3tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('ISA 570, 17-1', '4.1', 'Whilst not a specific requirement of IFRS, it is desirable to disclose the period that those charged with governance have considered when assessing going concern, where necessary have appropriate disclosures been given?\r\n<p>ISA 570 requires this period to be disclosed in the auditors’ report if it is less than one year from the end of the reporting period, and this has not been noted in the financial statements.</p>', '', '', 'section8', '3.15 Ab4', '59', 'Active', '2024-04-17 15:54:51')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c3` (`reference`, `extent`, `question`, `yesno`, `comment`, `type`, `code`, `c3tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('IAS 1.25', '4.2', 'When management are aware, in making their assessment of going concern, of material uncertainties related to events or conditions that cast significant doubt upon the entity’s ability to continue as a going concern, have those uncertainties been disclosed?', '', '', 'section8', '3.15 Ab4', '59', 'Active', '2024-04-17 15:54:51')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c3` (`reference`, `extent`, `question`, `yesno`, `comment`, `type`, `code`, `c3tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('IAS 1.25', '4.3', 'When management do not prepare financial statements on a going concern basis (i.e. break up basis), are the following disclosures given: <ul> <li>That fact;</li> <li>The basis on which the financial statements are prepared; and </li> <li>The reason why the entity is not considered to be going concern?</li> </ul>', '', '', 'section8', '3.15 Ab4', '59', 'Active', '2024-04-17 15:54:51')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c3` (`reference`, `extent`, `question`, `yesno`, `comment`, `type`, `code`, `c3tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('', '<b>5</b>', '<b>Accounting Policies – General</b>', '', '', 'section8', '3.15 Ab4', '59', 'Active', '2024-04-17 15:54:51')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c3` (`reference`, `extent`, `question`, `yesno`, `comment`, `type`, `code`, `c3tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('IAS 1.117', '5.1', 'Is there a description of all significant accounting policies?', '', '', 'section8', '3.15 Ab4', '59', 'Active', '2024-04-17 15:54:51')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c3` (`reference`, `extent`, `question`, `yesno`, `comment`, `type`, `code`, `c3tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('', '5.2 ', '<b>First time adoption of IFRS 9 / 15 / 16</b>\r\n<p>Where applicable, have supplementary checklist Ab4g “ <b>Additional Disclosures on transition to IFRS 15 and IFRS 9</b>” and / or Ab4h, “ <b>Additional disclosures on transition to IFRS 16 </b>” been completed to ensure that the appropriate disclosures have been given? </p>', '', '', 'section8', '3.15 Ab4', '59', 'Active', '2024-04-17 15:54:51')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c3` (`reference`, `extent`, `question`, `yesno`, `comment`, `type`, `code`, `c3tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('', '<b>6</b>', '<b>Change in Accounting Policies</b>', '', '', 'section8', '3.15 Ab4', '59', 'Active', '2024-04-17 15:54:51')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c3` (`reference`, `extent`, `question`, `yesno`, `comment`, `type`, `code`, `c3tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('IAS 8.28 (a) to (h) IAS 7.47 ', '6.1', 'When initial application of an IFRS has an effect on the current period or any prior period, or might have an effect on future periods, has the entity disclosed: <ul> <li>The title of the IFRS;</li> <li>Where applicable, that the change in accounting policy is made in accordance with its transitional provisions;</li> <li>The nature of the change in accounting policy;</li> <li>Where applicable, a description of the transitional provisions;</li> <li>Where applicable, the transitional provisions that might have an effects on future periods;</li> <li>For the current and each prior period presented, to the extent practicable, the amount of the adjustment for each financial statement line item affected (including, lines in the statement of cash flows);</li> <li>The amount of the adjustment relating to periods before those presented, to the extent practicable; and </li> <li>If retrospective application is impracticable for a particular prior period, or for periods before those presented, the circumstances that led to the existence of that condition and a description of how and from when the change in accounting policy has been applied?</li> </ul> <p>NB: This disclosure does not need to be repeated in subsequent periods.</p>', '', '', 'section8', '3.15 Ab4', '59', 'Active', '2024-04-17 15:54:51')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c3` (`reference`, `extent`, `question`, `yesno`, `comment`, `type`, `code`, `c3tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('IAS 8,29 (a) to (e) IAS 7.49', '6.2', 'Where a voluntary change in accounting policy has affected the current period or any prior period, has the entity disclosed: <ul> <li>The nature of the change in accounting policy;</li> <li>The reasons why applying the new accounting policy provides reliable and more relevant information;</li> <li>To the extent practicable, the amount of the adjustment for each financial statement line item affected (including lines in the Statement of Cash Flows); shown separately: <ul> <li>For the current period;</li> <li>For each prior period presented; and</li> <li>In aggregate for the periods before those presented.</li> </ul> </li> <li>If retrospective application is impracticable for a particular prior period, or for periods before those presented, the circumstances that led to the existence of that condition and a description of how and from when the change in accounting policy has been applied?</li> </ul> <p>NB: This disclosure does not need to be repeated in subsequent periods.</p>', '', '', 'section8', '3.15 Ab4', '59', 'Active', '2024-04-17 15:54:51')

post.question:
Array
(
    [0] => <b>Basis of Preparation</b>
    [1] => Is there an explicit and unreserved statement that these financial statements have been prepared in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards, or have the disclosures noted in point 2 below been given?
    [2] => <b>True and Fair Override</b>
    [3] => When the entity departs from a requirement of an IAS / IFRS / SIC / IFRIC due to those charged with governance believing that it is necessary to show a true and fair view, have the following disclosures been made:
<ol type="a">
    <li>that management has concluded that the financial statements present fairly the entity’s financial position, financial performance and cash flows;</li>
    <li>that the entity has complied with IFRS, except that it has departed from a particular requirement to achieve a fair presentation;</li>
    <li>the title of the IAS / IFRS / SIC / IFRIC from which the entity has departed;</li>
    <li>the nature of the departure, including:
        <ul>
            <li>the treatment that would have been required; </li>
            <li>the reason why that treatment would be misleading; </li>
            <li>the treatment actually adopted; and</li>
            <li>for each period presented, the financial effect of the departure on each item in the financial statements that would have been reported in complying with the requirement?</li>
        </ul>
    </li>
</ol>
    [4] => When the entity has departed from a requirement an IAS / IFRS / SIC / IFRIC in a prior period, and that departure affects the amounts recognised in the current period, have the disclosures set out in 2.1(c) and (d) above been given?
    [5] => In the extremely rare circumstance where management conclude that a departure from an IAS / IFRS / SIC / IFRIC is necessary to give a true and fair view, however, the relevant regulatory framework prohibits such as departure, have the following disclosures been given:
<ul>
    <li>The title of the IAS / IFRS / SIC / IFRIC;</li>
    <li>The nature of the requirement;</li>
    <li>The reason why management has concluded that complying with that requirement conflicts with the requirement to give a true and fair view; and </li>
    <li>For each period presented, the adjustments to each item in the financial statements that management has concluded necessary to achieve a fair presentation?</li>
</ul>
    [6] => Is the effect and reason for any departure from any of the following accounting concepts disclosed:
<ul>
    <li>Going concern;</li>
    <li>Consistency;</li>
    <li>Prudence;</li>
    <li>Accruals; and</li>
    <li>Determination of aggregate amounts by separate determination of each individual asset and liability?</li>
</ul>
    [7] => <b>Long and Short Accounting Periods</b>
    [8] => Where the financial statements are for a period other than one year (i.e. there is a long or short accounting period) are the following disclosed:
<ul>
    <li>That fact;</li>
    <li>The reason for having a longer or shorter period; and</li>
    <li>The fact that comparative amounts presented in the financial statements (including the related notes) are not entirely comparable?</li>
</ul>
    [9] => <b>Going Concern</b>
    [10] => Whilst not a specific requirement of IFRS, it is desirable to disclose the period that those charged with governance have considered when assessing going concern, where necessary have appropriate disclosures been given?
<p>ISA 570 requires this period to be disclosed in the auditors’ report if it is less than one year from the end of the reporting period, and this has not been noted in the financial statements.</p>
    [11] => When management are aware, in making their assessment of going concern, of material uncertainties related to events or conditions that cast significant doubt upon the entity’s ability to continue as a going concern, have those uncertainties been disclosed?
    [12] => When management do not prepare financial statements on a going concern basis (i.e. break up basis), are the following disclosures given:
<ul>
    <li>That fact;</li>
    <li>The basis on which the financial statements are prepared; and </li>
    <li>The reason why the entity is not considered to be going concern?</li>
</ul>
    [13] => <b>Accounting Policies – General</b>
    [14] => Is there a description of all significant accounting policies?
    [15] => <b>First time adoption of IFRS 9 / 15 / 16</b>
<p>Where applicable, have supplementary checklist Ab4g “ <b>Additional Disclosures on transition to IFRS 15 and IFRS 9</b>” and / or Ab4h, “ <b>Additional disclosures on transition to IFRS 16 </b>” been completed to ensure that the appropriate disclosures have been given? </p>
    [16] => <b>Change in Accounting Policies</b>
    [17] => When initial application of an IFRS has an effect on the current period or any prior period, or might have an effect on future periods, has the entity disclosed:
<ul>
    <li>The title of the IFRS;</li>
    <li>Where applicable, that the change in accounting policy is made in accordance with its transitional provisions;</li>
    <li>The nature of the change in accounting policy;</li>
    <li>Where applicable, a description of the transitional provisions;</li>
    <li>Where applicable, the transitional provisions that might have an effects on future periods;</li>
    <li>For the current and each prior period presented, to the extent practicable, the amount of the adjustment for each financial statement line item affected (including, lines in the statement of cash flows);</li>
    <li>The amount of the adjustment relating to periods before those presented, to the extent practicable; and </li>
    <li>If retrospective application is impracticable for a particular prior period, or for periods before those presented, the circumstances that led to the existence of that condition and a description of how and from when the change in accounting policy has been applied?</li>
</ul>
<p>NB: This disclosure does not need to be repeated in subsequent periods.</p>
    [18] => Where a voluntary change in accounting policy has affected the current period or any prior period, has the entity disclosed:
<ul>
    <li>The nature of the change in accounting policy;</li>
    <li>The reasons why applying the new accounting policy provides reliable and more relevant information;</li>
    <li>To the extent practicable, the amount of the adjustment for each financial statement line item affected (including lines in the Statement of Cash Flows); shown separately:
        <ul>
            <li>For the current period;</li>
            <li>For each prior period presented; and</li>
            <li>In aggregate for the periods before those presented.</li>
        </ul>
    </li>
    <li>If retrospective application is impracticable for a particular prior period, or for periods before those presented, the circumstances that led to the existence of that condition and a description of how and from when the change in accounting policy has been applied?</li>
</ul>
<p>NB: This disclosure does not need to be repeated in subsequent periods.</p>
)
